attributes.action: Hold a vote of no confidence in the executive due to mismanagement of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS funding issues
https://fullfact.org/health/spending-english-nhs/

Hidden figures: private care in the English NHS - this isn't cost effective
https://www.bma.org.uk/collective-voice/influence/key-negotiations/nhs-funding/privatisation-report

UNISON survey shows scrapping of student nurse bursaries will lead to major shortages
https://www.unison.org.uk/news/press-release/2015/11/unison-survey-shows-scrapping-of-student-nurse-bursaries-will-lead-to-major-shortages/
attributes.background:
Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt has conceded the NHS in England is facing "completely unacceptable" problems. He said there was "no excuse" for some of the difficulties highlighted during the BBC's NHS week.10 Feb 2017

The Government have failed the NHS and should be held to account.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

We used to accept petitions that called for a vote of no confidence. However, the Petitions Committee can’t schedule votes of no confidence. This was often frustrating and disappointing for petitioners. Petitions calling for action on policy are more likely to be an effective way of achieving the change you want.
